Better Adoption & Onboarding

New users have no idea or sense of what the current campaign stage is (or the campaign scope) and therefore no idea what type of idea to propose or engage with.

This makes the onboarding process very confusing and presents a significant barrier to adoption. For example, users may try to submit proposals at the wrong time, or not now how or what to engage with or when, and may abandon the process as a result or flood the home page with misplaced content.

Voting Integrity is to be a tantamount to our success as a decentralized organization. Based upon cursory experimentation, the Voting App has weaknesses that expose a potential risk to our Voting Integrity.

Currently it appears that you can trivially bypass PIN entry lockout and brute force entry. A sophisticated attacker with access to either user devices or the saved QR codes (via spyware, social engineering, or other attacks) can trivially hijack their voting rights.

project_title: Development overlap between community and IOG, and project Catalyst information overload
project_context: It's not exactly clear what IOG is developing for Voltaire, and what the community should be funding for development through project Catalyst. Using simple questions and prompts (like this form I'm using now) helps to guide participants, but there are many improvements that could be made to this governance model. It is hard to identify what is left up to the community to solve, in regards to improving catalyst, and what is actively being developed by IOG (or soon will be) and will be released with Voltaire. When Voltaire?

In educating users about what Cardano is and can be it is important to start at a level they can quickly comprehend. The greatest risk of losing people trying Project Catalyst for the first time will be the leap they need to make to come away with something worthwhile - The take home message.

Everyone has limited time and resources, each Fund should be laser-focused for the challenges in order to increase the chance of success. 9 Funds in one year is ambitious, so why not make specific themes? Create limits on the scope of submissions so the contributors, reviewers, and voters can all be focused under specific themes.

What you risk the most is the ability for people to evaluate very different proposals. I support focused challenges as this is easier to compare and consider in a short period of time. Secondly, as I read about all these amazing ideas which use blockchain, we should really be focusing on what is available for Cardano now or distinguish between action ready proposals and horizon building proposals.

This should be the focus for at least 5 funds to really improve the output from Catalyst.

project_title: The Cardano ecosystem needs a trusted, decentralized source of information
project_context: Project Catalyst's ultimate goal is launch a decentralized governance model driven by the Cardano blockchain. Individuals will need to make informed and educated voting decisions that they think is in the interest of themselves and the health of the network. There needs to be a decentralized method of trusted information sharing that voters of as many intelligence level and ability as possible can reference and find useful in some manner to make the best decisions possible.
